hero.title: Frequently Asked Questions
hero.description: Find answers to the most common questions about Invoo, electronic invoicing and Verifactu

q1.question: Is Invoo VeriFactu compliant?
q1.answer: Yes. Invoo is built to meet the VeriFactu Regulation (RD 1007/2023). We generate the VeriFactu QR and manage the AEAT submission flow through our API provider. You can review statuses and export evidence for audits.

q2.question: When does VeriFactu become mandatory?
q2.answer: For software developers, from July 2025; for companies, from January 2026; and for the self-employed, from July 2026. Some details roll out in stages. We'll notify you in-app when we switch to production AEAT endpoints. If you wait until the last minute (like 38-40% of the self-employed, per surveys), you might face rushed adaptation costs; consider testing Invoo now for a smooth transition.

q3.question: Does VeriFactu mean invoices are "approved" instantly by AEAT?
q3.answer: No. Your invoice includes the QR and is submitted to AEAT, but acceptance depends on them. You can track the status and correct it if needed (e.g., rectifications).

q4.question: Do I need my own digital certificate?
q4.answer: Not to start. Our provider handles the secure exchange with AEAT; we manage technical payloads and return the QR and status. For enterprise customizations (like using your certificate), contact us later.

q5.question: Who is required to use VeriFactu?
q5.answer: Self-employed, SMEs, and companies billing under €6M annually, except for exemptions like REGE or large SII contributors. If you're a freelancer with few clients, choose simple software like Invoo; for gestorías with hundreds of clients, contact us for a better plan.

q6.question: What are the penalties for non-compliance with VeriFactu?
q6.answer: Up to €50,000 for not using approved software or tampering with records. Avoid it with Invoo, which ensures traceability. If preferring alternatives, check they're AEAT-certified, but Invoo integrates directly, reducing operational risks.

q7.question: Can I still use Excel or Word for invoicing?
q7.answer: No, VeriFactu requires approved software that sends data in real-time to AEAT. Invoo replaces that with a dead-simple interface; as an option, migrate Excel data via CSV, but we recommend automating to save billable time.

q1.question: Who is Invoo for?
q1.answer: Freelancers (autónomos) in Spain and their gestorías. We optimize for Spain-specific compliance and workflows. We don't replace your gestor, but enhance it, improving retention by reducing coordination errors.

q2.question: What does Invoo include at launch?
q2.answer: Core invoicing with VeriFactu QR + AEAT submission, expense capture, quarterly pre-calcs (Modelos 130 y 303), gestoría access, and CSV exports. Advanced features like multi-currency roll out progressively. Test the free plan to validate; if needing scalability, upgrade to Pro.

q3.question: Is there a mobile app?
q3.answer: Desktop-first, but mobile web is fully usable for on-the-go receipt scanning. A native app may come if demanded; meanwhile, use the browser for operational simplicity.

q4.question: Does Invoo support recurring invoices?
q4.answer: Yes, automate monthly sends for fixed clients. Set variations for extras without complexity. This maximizes billable hours; alternate with manual reminders if preferring total control, but automation lowers errors.

q5.question: Is Invoo easy for non-tech-savvy users?
q5.answer: Absolutely, with a dead-simple interface and step-by-step guides. Create invoices in <30 seconds without manual calculations. If the learning curve concerns you, start with our free onboarding; or integrate with your gestoría to delegate.

q6.question: Does Invoo handle multi-currency and international VAT?
q6.answer: Yes, it supports automatic conversions and VAT handling for foreign clients. It reduces tax complexity; as an alternative, export to external tools, but native integration simplifies retention.

q1.question: How much does Invoo cost?
q1.answer: Freelancers: Free Starter and Pro at €9.90/month; Gestorías: Free dashboard and custom Enterprise. Annual plans are available with savings. See the Pricing page for current tiers.

q2.question: Can I cancel anytime? Do you offer refunds?
q2.answer: Yes, monthly cancels anytime; 30-day refund on annual upgrades.

q3.question: Is the gestoría plan really free?
q3.answer: Yes, access to client data, CSV exports, notifications, and summaries at no cost. Enterprise for custom integrations.

q1.question: Where is my data stored?
q1.answer: In EU-based infrastructure with GDPR-compliant processors. We minimize retention and offer exports on request.

q2.question: Who can see my invoices and expenses?
q2.answer: Only you and any gestoría you explicitly invite. We never sell data; revoke access anytime.

q3.question: Can I export my data?
q3.answer: Yes, CSV (and soon XML for compliance artifacts) on demand.

q1.question: What happens if AEAT is down?
q1.answer: We queue submissions and retry automatically; you'll see a pending status until resolved.

q2.question: When will Invoo be generally available?
q2.answer: We're preparing to launch with a small pilot, then expanding. We won't publish an exact date until ready. Join the waitlist for early access.

q3.question: How does VeriFactu affect my gestoría?
q3.answer: Gestorías must use it for their own invoicing and will benefit from dashboards like ours: real-time client visibility, zero manual entry.

header.title: Helping freelancers and gestorías work better together
header.description: Invoo is the gestoría-friendly invoicing platform built to simplify compliance, save time, and strengthen collaboration

block1.title: Born from Real Experience
block1.description:
When we moved to Spain, we quickly discovered the maze that freelancers navigate daily — endless invoicing, scattered expenses, and complex tax obligations. Every autónomo we met shared the same story: hours lost to paperwork that should take minutes.
Meanwhile, gestorías told us their side: outdated Excel files, manual data entry, and constant back-and-forth with clients just to get basic information.
Then Verifactu arrived — a regulatory change that could've made things worse. Instead, we saw opportunity. The perfect moment to build something better.
That's how Invoo was born: a platform that speaks both languages — the simplicity freelancers need and the comprehensive data gestorías require. Less time on paperwork, more time on what matters.

block2.title: Our Vision
block2.description:
We believe invoicing shouldn't feel like a tax exam. It should just work.
Our mission is simple: connect freelancers, their clients, and gestorías in one seamless workflow. Professional invoices that create themselves. Verifactu compliance that happens automatically. Gestoría dashboards that update in real-time.
No more "can you resend that invoice from March?" No more Sunday afternoons lost to Excel. Just smooth, simple, compliant invoicing that everyone can trust.

items.item1:
Built for Spanish reality
Not another generic tool pretending to understand Spain. We know what Modelo 130 means. We get why your gestoría needs that specific CSV format.
items.item2:
Verifactu? Already handled
QR codes, AEAT submission, compliance checks — all automatic. You create invoices, we handle the bureaucracy.
items.item3:
Gestorías love us too
Free access, real-time data, no more chasing documents. We're not replacing gestorías — we're making their work easier.
items.item4:
Complexity eliminated
Every feature earns its place by saving you time. If it doesn't make your life simpler, it doesn't make it into Invoo.

block4.title: Join Us Early
block4.description:
Invoo launches soon. Right now, we're working hand-in-hand with pioneering freelancers and forward-thinking gestorías to perfect every detail.
Want to be among the first to escape invoicing chaos? Join our waiting list and get early access when we launch.
The future of invoicing in Spain starts here. And it starts with you.
